Updater#

class Updater(connection: Connection, *, weight_reduction: Callable[[Tensor, int], Tensor] | None = None, bias_reduction: Callable[[Tensor, int], Tensor] | None = None, delay_reduction: Callable[[Tensor, int], Tensor] | None = None)[source]#

Bases: Module

Wraps a connection for updates and on-update hooks.

This encloses a connection object and provides some top-level properties, for others the enclosed connection can be called through connection.

Specifically, this is used to accumulate multiple updates through different trainers, perform any additional logic on the updates, the apply them. It also allows for hooks like Normalization and Clamping to be tied to updates rather than inference steps.

Updaters should call the update_weight(), update_bias(), and update_delay() functions to add their own updates. Hooks which target updates (such as bounding hooks) should target the properties ending in _update. Once these are altered, no more updates can be accumulated until after the next call.

The arguments ending in _reduction should have a signature as follows:

reduction(input: torch.Tensor, dim: int) -> torch.Tensor

and examples include torch.mean(), torch.sum(), :py:func`torch.amin`, and :py:func`torch.amax`.

The reduced potentiative updates are added to the value and the depressive updates are subtracted from the value.

Parameters:

connection (Connection) – wrapped connection.

Keyword Arguments:

  • weight_reduction (Callable[[torch.Tensor, int], torch.Tensor] | None, optional) – function to reduce weights from multiple trainers. Defaults to None.

  • bias_reduction (Callable[[torch.Tensor, int], torch.Tensor] | None, optional) – function to reduce biases from multiple trainers. Defaults to None.

  • delay_reduction (Callable[[torch.Tensor, int], torch.Tensor] | None, optional) – function to reduce delays from multiple trainers. Defaults to None.

bias_bounding(bounding: FullBounding, max: float, min: float, **kwargs: Any) → None[source]#

Adds full bounding to biases.

Parameters:

  • bounding (FullBounding) – bounding function to use.

  • max (float) – upper bound of biases.

  • min (float) – lower bound of biases

  • **kwargs (Any) – passed as keyword arguments to bounding.

Note

This clears away anything set by bias_upper_bounding() and bias_lower_bounding().

bias_lower_bounding(bounding: HalfBounding, min: float, **kwargs: Any) → None[source]#

Adds lower bounding to biases.

Parameters:

  • bounding (HalfBounding) – bounding function to use.

  • min (float) – lower bound of biases

  • **kwargs (Any) – passed as keyword arguments to bounding.

Note

This clears away anything set by bias_bounding().

property bias_reduction: Callable[[Tensor, int], Tensor]#

Reduction used for multiple bias updates, positive and negative.

This function should have the following signature.

reduction(input: torch.Tensor, dim: int) -> torch.Tensor

The argument dim can also take a tuple of integers as with most appropriate functions in PyTorch but is never given a tuple here. Dimensions reduced along should not be kept by default. Valid PyTorch functions include byt are not limited to torch.mean(), torch.sum(), :py:func`torch.amin`, and :py:func`torch.amax`.

Parameters:

value (Callable[[torch.Tensor, int], torch.Tensor]) – function for reducing bias updates.

Returns:

function for reducing bias updates.

Return type:

Callable[[torch.Tensor, int], torch.Tensor]

bias_update(pos_update: Tensor | None, neg_update: Tensor | None) → None[source]#

Adds bias update terms.

The bias updates are applied in the following manner.

bias = bias + pos_update - neg_update
Parameters:

  • pos_update (torch.Tensor | None) – positive bias update component.

  • neg_update (torch.Tensor | None) – negative bias update component.

bias_upper_bounding(bounding: HalfBounding, max: float, **kwargs: Any) → None[source]#

Adds upper bounding to biases.

Parameters:

  • bounding (HalfBounding) – bounding function to use.

  • max (float) – upper bound of biases

  • **kwargs (Any) – passed as keyword arguments to bounding.

Note

This clears away anything set by bias_bounding().

property connection: Connection#

Connection submodule.

Returns:

existing connection.

Return type:

Connection

Valid PyTorch functions include byt are not limited to torch.mean(), torch.sum(), :py:func`torch.amin`, and :py:func`torch.amax`.

delay_update(pos_update: Tensor | None, neg_update: Tensor | None) → None[source]#

Adds delay update terms.

The delay updates are applied in the following manner.

delay = delay + pos_update - neg_update
Parameters:

  • pos_update (torch.Tensor | None) – positive delay update component.

  • neg_update (torch.Tensor | None) – negative delay update component.

forward() → None[source]#

Applies stored updates and resets for the next set.

Note

This does not check if a connection has a trainable bias or trainable delay before performing the update. If the updates are not manually set nor added by a trainer, this behaves normally. If they are, the included connections will silently not update parameters they don’t have, but this isn’t guaranteed behavior for 3rd party ones.

property neg_bias_update: Tensor | None#

Negative component of bias updates.

If this value hasn’t been overridden with a setter call, it will reduce the stored updates and return that. Otherwise it will return the value used to override. This is reset upon applying updates.

Parameters:

value (torch.Tensor) – overwrite value of negative bias updates.

Returns:

current positive negative updates.

Return type:

torch.Tensor | None

property neg_delay_update: Tensor | None#

Negative component of delay updates.

If this value hasn’t been overridden with a setter call, it will reduce the stored updates and return that. Otherwise it will return the value used to override. This is reset upon applying updates.

Parameters:

value (torch.Tensor) – overwrite value of negative delay updates.

Returns:

current positive negative updates.

Return type:

torch.Tensor | None

property neg_weight_update: Tensor | None#

Negative component of weight updates.

If this value hasn’t been overridden with a setter call, it will reduce the stored updates and return that. Otherwise it will return the value used to override. This is reset upon applying updates.

Parameters:

value (torch.Tensor) – overwrite value of negative weight updates.

Returns:

current positive negative updates.

Return type:

torch.Tensor | None

property pos_bias_update: Tensor | None#

Positive component of bias updates.

If this value hasn’t been overridden with a setter call, it will reduce the stored updates and return that. Otherwise it will return the value used to override. This is reset upon applying updates.

Parameters:

value (torch.Tensor) – overwrite value of positive bias updates.
